meanings.definition: To carry off mysteriously or secretly
meanings.sent1: The magician was spiriting away the rabbit from the hat.
meanings.sent2: The thief was spiriting the jewels out of the museum undetected.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous ghost was spiriting away people's socks just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The shadow seemed to be spiriting the light away from the room.
meanings.sent5: The fog was spiriting the city into a mysterious realm.

meanings.sent1: The coach was spiriting the team to victory with his motivational speeches.
meanings.sent2: The music was spiriting the crowd into a joyful dance.
meanings.sent3: The lively melody was spiriting the plants to grow taller in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her positive energy was spiriting hope into the hearts of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The colorful artwork was spiriting life into the dull room.

meanings.sent1: The messenger was spiriting the important documents to the king.
meanings.sent2: The spy was spiriting the classified information across enemy lines.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was spiriting the acorns to its secret hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The wind was spiriting the fallen leaves down the deserted street.
meanings.sent5: The river was spiriting the fallen petals away to unknown destinations.
